member.name: M:Nexmo.Api.Accounts.IAccountClient.TopUpAccountBalance(Nexmo.Api.Accounts.TopUpRequest,Nexmo.Api.Request.Credentials)
member.summary: You can top up your account using this API when you have enabled auto-reload in the dashboard. The amount added by the top-up operation will be the same amount as was added in the payment when auto-reload was enabled. Your account balance is checked every 5-10 minutes and if it falls below the threshold and auto-reload is enabled, then it will be topped up automatically. Use this endpoint if you need to top up at times when your credit may be exhausted more quickly than the auto-reload may occur.

member.name: M:Nexmo.Api.Accounts.IAccountClient.ChangeAccountSettings(Nexmo.Api.Accounts.AccountSettingsRequest,Nexmo.Api.Request.Credentials)
member.summary: Update the default callback URLs (where the webhooks are sent to) associated with your account: * Callback URL for incoming SMS messages * Callback URL for delivery receipts Note: that the URLs you provide must be valid and active.Nexmo will check that they return a 200 OK response before the setting is saved

member.name: M:Nexmo.Api.Accounts.IAccountClient.RetrieveApiSecrets(System.String,Nexmo.Api.Request.Credentials)
member.summary: Many of Nexmo's APIs are accessed using an API key and secret. It is recommended that you change or "rotate" your secrets from time to time for security purposes. This section provides the API interface for achieving this. Note: to work on secrets for your secondary accounts, you may authenticate with your primary credentials and supply the secondary API keys as URL parameters to these API endpoints.

member.summary: If do not set number in international format or you are not sure if number is correctly formatted, set country with the two-character country code. For example, GB, US. Verify works out the international phone number for you.

member.summary: The name of the company or App you are using Verify for. This 18 character alphanumeric string is used in the body of Verify message. For example: "Your brand PIN is ..".

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.sender_id
member.summary: An 11 character alphanumeric string to specify the SenderID for SMS sent by Verify. Depending on the destination of the phone number you are applying, restrictions may apply. By default, sender_id is VERIFY.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.code_length
member.summary: The length of the PIN. Possible values are 6 or 4 characters. The default value is 4.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.lg
member.summary: By default, the SMS or text-to-speech (TTS) message is generated in the locale that matches the number. For example, the text message or TTS message for a 33* number is sent in French. Use this parameter to explicitly control the language, accent and gender used for the Verify request. The default language is en-us.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.require_type
member.summary:
Restrict verification to a certain network type. Possible values are: All (Default) Mobile Landline
Note: contact support@nexmo.com to enable this feature.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.pin_expiry
member.summary: The PIN validity time from generation. This is an integer value between 60 and 3600 seconds. The default is 300 seconds. When specified together, pin_expiry must be an integer multiple of next_event_wait. Otherwise, pin_expiry is set to equal next_event_wait. For example: pin_expiry = 360 seconds, so next_event_wait = 120 seconds - all three attempts have the same PIN. pin_expiry = 240 seconds, so next_event_wait = 120 seconds - 1st and 2nd attempts have the same PIN, third attempt has a different PIN. pin_expiry = 120 (or 200 or 400 seconds) - each attempt has a different PIN.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.next_event_wait
member.summary: An integer value between 60 and 900 seconds inclusive that specifies the wait time between attempts to deliver the PIN. Verify calculates the default value based on the average time taken by users to complete verification.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.workflow_id
member.summary: The workflow ID for selecting verification workflow - choose between 1 and 5 full guide https://developer.nexmo.com/verify/guides/workflows-and-events workflow_id = 1, (Default Workflow): SMS -> TTS -> TTS workflow_id = 2, SMS -> SMS -> TTS workflow_id = 3, TTS -> TTS workflow_id = 4, SMS -> SMS workflow_id = 5, SMS -> TTS

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.from
member.summary: An alphanumeric string giving your sender address. For example, from=MyCompany20. See our information Global messaging. This is also called the SenderID.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.to
member.summary: A single phone number in international format, that is E.164 . For example, to=447700900000. You can set one recipient only for each request.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.type
member.summary: Default value is text. Possible values are: text - for plain text SMS, you must also set the text parameter. binary - for binary SMS you must also set the udh and body parameters. Do not set the text parameter. wappush - a WAP Push . You must also set the title and url parameters. Do not set the text or body parameters. unicode - SMS in unicode contain fewer characters than text. Only use unicode when your SMS must contain special characters. For more information, see Encoding. vcal - send a calendar event. You send your vCal encoded calendar event in the vcal parameter. vcard - send a business card. You send your vCard encoded business card in the the vcard parameter.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.text
member.summary: The SMS body. Messages where type is text (the default) are in UTF-8 with URL encoding. You send "Déjà vu" as a text (type=text) message as long as you encode it as D%C3%A9j%C3%A0+vu. You can see the full UTF-8 character set here . To test if your message can be URL encoded, use: http://www.url-encode-decode.com/ . If you cannot find the character you want to send in these two references, you should use unicode. For more information, see Encoding.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.status_report_req
member.summary: Set to 1 to receive a Delivery Receipt (DLR). To receive the DLR, you have to either: Configure a webhook endpoint in Dashboard. Set the callback parameter.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.vcard
member.summary: A business card in vCard. You must set the type parameter to vcard.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.vcal
member.summary: A calendar event in vCal. You must set the type parameter to vcal.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.ttl
member.summary: The lifespan of this SMS in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.callback
member.summary: The webhook endpoint the delivery receipt for this sms is sent to. This parameter overrides the webhook endpoint you set in Dashboard. This must be a fully formed URL. For example: https://mysite.com/sms_api_callback.php.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.message_class
member.summary: Set to: 0 for Flash SMS, 1 - ME-specific, 2 - SIM / USIM specific, 3 - TE-specific See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Coding_Scheme Note: Flash SMS is not fully support by all handsets and carriers.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.udh
member.summary: Your custom Hex encoded User Data Header (UDH) . For example, udh=06050415811581.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.protocol_id
member.summary: The value in decimal format for the higher level protocol to use for this SMS. For example, to send a binary SMS to the SIM Toolkit, this would be protocol-id=127. Ensure that the value of protocol-id is aligned with udh.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.body
member.summary: Hex encoded binary data. For example, body=0011223344556677.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.title
member.summary: The title for a wappush SMS. For example: MyCompanyIsGreat.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.url
member.summary: The URL your user taps to navigate to your website.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.validity
member.summary: The availability period for a wappush type SMS in milliseconds. For example, validity=86400000. If you do not set this parameter, the default is 48 hours.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.client_ref

member.summary: One of: VALID or INVALID

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyCheck.IpAddress
member.summary: The IP address, if available (this field is no longer used).

member.summary: The Verify request to check. This is the request_id you received in the response to the Verify request

member.summary: The verification code entered by your user.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyCheckRequest.IpAddress
member.summary: (This field is no longer used)

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.RequestId
member.summary: The request_id that you received in the response to the Verify request and used in the Verify check request.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.EventId
member.summary: The ID of the verification event, such as an SMS or TTS call.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.Price
member.summary: The cost incurred for this request.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.Currency
member.summary: The currency code.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.EstimatedPriceMessagesSent
member.summary: This field may not be present, depending on your pricing model. The value indicates the cost (in EUR) of the calls made and messages sent for the verification process. This value may be updated during and shortly after the request completes because user input events can overlap with message/call events. When this field is present, the total cost of the verification is the sum of this field and the price field.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyControlRequest.RequestId
member.summary: The request_id you received in the response to the Verify request.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyControlRequest.Cmd
member.summary: The possible commands are cancel to request cancellation of the verification process, or trigger_next_event to advance to the next verification event (if any). Cancellation is only possible 30 seconds after the start of the verification request and before the second event (either TTS or SMS) has taken place. must be one of 'cancel' or 'trigger_next_event'

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyRequest.Brand
member.summary: An 18-character alphanumeric string you can use to personalize the verification request SMS body, to help users identify your company or application name. For example: "Your Acme Inc PIN is ..."

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyRequest.SenderId
member.summary: An 11-character alphanumeric string that represents the identity of the sender of the verification request: https://developer.nexmo.com/messaging/sms/guides/custom-sender-id. Depending on the destination of the phone number you are sending the verification SMS to, restrictions might apply.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyRequest.WorkflowId
member.summary: Selects the predefined sequence of SMS and TTS (Text To Speech) actions to use in order to convey the PIN to your user. For example, an id of 1 identifies the workflow SMS - TTS - TTS. For a list of all workflows and their associated ids, please visit the developer portal.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.Number
member.summary: The mobile or landline phone number to verify. Unless you are setting country explicitly, this number must be in E.164 format.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.Country
member.summary: If you do not provide number in international format or you are not sure if number is correctly formatted, specify the two-character country code in country. Verify will then format the number for you.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.CodeLength
member.summary: The length of the verification code. Must be 4 or 6

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.Lg
member.summary: By default, the SMS or text-to-speech (TTS) message is generated in the locale that matches the number. For example, the text message or TTS message for a 33* number is sent in French. Use this parameter to explicitly control the language used for the Verify request. A list of languages is available: https://developer.nexmo.com/verify/guides/verify-languages

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.PinExpiry
member.summary: How long the generated verification code is valid for, in seconds. When you specify both pin_expiry and next_event_wait then pin_expiry must be an integer multiple of next_event_wait otherwise pin_expiry is defaulted to equal next_event_wait. See changing the event timings: https://developer.nexmo.com/verify/guides/changing-default-timings.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.NextEventWait
member.summary: Specifies the wait time in seconds between attempts to deliver the verification code. Must be between 60 and 900

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyResponseBase.Status
member.summary: A value of 0 indicates that your user entered the correct code. If it is non-zero, check the error_text.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Verify.VerifyResponseBase.ErrorText
member.summary: If the status is non-zero, this explains the error encountered.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.Endpoint
member.summary: Connect to a single endpoint.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.From
member.summary: A number in E.164 format that identifies the caller. This must be one of your Nexmo virtual numbers, another value will result in the caller ID being unknown. If the caller is an app user, this option should be omitted.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.EventType
member.summary: Set to synchronous to: make the connect action synchronous enable eventUrl to return an NCCO that overrides the current NCCO when a call moves to specific states.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.Timeout
member.summary: If the call is unanswered, set the number in seconds before Nexmo stops ringing endpoint. The default value is 60.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.Limit
member.summary: Maximum length of the call in seconds. The default and maximum value is 7200 seconds (2 hours).

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.MachineDetection
member.summary: Configure the behavior when Nexmo detects that a destination is an answerphone. Set to either: continue - Nexmo sends an HTTP request to event_url with the Call event machine hangup - end the Call

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.EventUrl
member.summary: Set the webhook endpoint that Nexmo calls asynchronously on each of the possible Call States. If eventType is set to synchronous the eventUrl can return an NCCO that overrides the current NCCO when a timeout occurs.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.EventMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method Nexmo uses to make the request to eventUrl. The default value is POST.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.RingbackTone
member.summary: A URL value that points to a ringbackTone to be played back on repeat to the caller, so they don't hear silence. The ringbackTone will automatically stop playing when the call is fully connected. It's not recommended to use this parameter when connecting to a phone endpoint, as the carrier will supply their own ringbackTone. Example: "ringbackTone": "http://example.com/ringbackTone.wav".

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.Name
member.summary: The name of the Conversation room. Names are namespaced to the application level.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.MusicOnHoldUrl
member.summary: A URL to the mp3 file to stream to participants until the conversation starts. By default the conversation starts when the first person calls the virtual number associated with your Voice app. To stream this mp3 before the moderator joins the conversation, set startOnEnter to false for all users other than the moderator.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.StartOnEnter
member.summary: The default value of true ensures that the conversation starts when this caller joins conversation name. Set to false for attendees in a moderated conversation.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.EndOnExit
member.summary: Specifies whether a moderated conversation ends when the moderator hangs up. This is set to false by default, which means that the conversation only ends when the last remaining participant hangs up, regardless of whether the moderator is still on the call. Set endOnExit to true to terminate the conversation when the moderator hangs up.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.Record
member.summary: Set to true to record this conversation. For standard conversations, recordings start when one or more attendees connects to the conversation. For moderated conversations, recordings start when the moderator joins. That is, when an NCCO is executed for the named conversation where startOnEnter is set to true. When the recording is terminated, the URL you download the recording from is sent to the event URL. By default audio is recorded in MP3 format. See the recording guide for more details

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.EventUrl
member.summary: Url to receive webhooks at for the conversation

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.EventMethod
member.summary: Method to use on the webhooks for the conversation

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.CanSpeak
member.summary: A list of leg UUIDs that this participant can be heard by. If not provided, the participant can be heard by everyone. If an empty list is provided, the participant will not be heard by anyone

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.CanHear
member.summary: A list of leg UUIDs that this participant can hear. If not provided, the participant can hear everyone. If an empty list is provided, the participant will not hear any other participants

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.AppEndpoint.User
member.summary: the username of the user to connect to. This username must have been added as a user

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.Endpoint.Type
member.summary: the type of endpoint being connected

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.PhoneEndpoint.Number
member.summary: The phone number to connect to in E.164 format.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.PhoneEndpoint.DtmfAnswer
member.summary: Set the digits that are sent to the user as soon as the Call is answered. The * and # digits are respected. You create pauses using p. Each pause is 500ms.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.PhoneEndpoint.OnAnswer
member.summary: An object containing a required url key. The URL serves an NCCO to execute in the number being connected to, before that call is joined to your existing conversation. Optionally, the ringbackTone key can be specified with a URL value that points to a ringbackTone to be played back on repeat to the caller, so they do not hear just silence. The ringbackTone will automatically stop playing when the call is fully connected. Example: {"url":"https://example.com/answer", "ringbackTone":"http://example.com/ringbackTone.wav" }. Please note, the key ringback is still supported.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.SipEndpoint.Uri
member.summary: the SIP URI to the endpoint you are connecting to in the format sip:rebekka@sip.example.com.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.SipEndpoint.Headers
member.summary: key => value string pairs containing any metadata you need e.g. { "location": "New York City", "occupation": "developer" }

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.VbcEndpoint.Extension
member.summary: the VBC extension to connect the call to.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.WebsocketEndpoint.Uri
member.summary: the URI to the websocket you are streaming to.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.WebsocketEndpoint.ContentType
member.summary: the internet media type for the audio you are streaming. Possible values are: audio/l16;rate=16000 or audio/l16;rate=8000.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.WebsocketEndpoint.Headers
member.summary: an object containing any metadata you want. See connecting to a websocket for example headers

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.InputAction.TimeOut
member.summary: The result of the callee's activity is sent to the eventUrl webhook endpoint timeOut seconds after the last action. The default value is 3. Max is 10.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.InputAction.MaxDigits
member.summary: The number of digits the user can press. The maximum value is 20, the default is 4 digits.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.InputAction.SubmitOnHash
member.summary: Set to true so the callee's activity is sent to your webhook endpoint at eventUrl after they press #. If # is not pressed the result is submitted after timeOut seconds. The default value is false. That is, the result is sent to your webhook endpoint after timeOut seconds.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.InputAction.EventUrl
member.summary: Nexmo sends the digits pressed by the callee to this URL after timeOut pause in activity or when # is pressed.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.InputAction.EventMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method used to send event information to event_url The default value is POST.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.MultiInputAction.EventUrl
member.summary: Nexmo sends the digits pressed by the callee to this URL 1) after timeOut pause in activity or when # is pressed for DTMF or 2) after user stops speaking or 30 seconds of speech for speech input.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.MultiInputAction.EventMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method used to send event information to event_url The default value is POST.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.MultiInputAction.Dtmf
member.summary: DTMF settings. Should be specified to enable DTMF input. If all the DTMF input settings will have default values, it should be specified as empty object NOTE: this is serialized as an empty object if not initalized by the user

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.MultiInputAction.Speech
member.summary: Speech recognition settings. Should be specified to enable speech input.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.NotifyAction.Payload
member.summary: The JSON object body to send to your event URL

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.NotifyAction.EventUrl
member.summary: The URL to send events to. If you return an NCCO when you receive a notification, it will replace the current NCCO

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.NotifyAction.EventMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method to use when sending payload to your eventUrl

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.Format
member.summary: Record the Call in a specific format. The default value is mp3, or wav when recording more than 2 channels.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.Split
member.summary: Record the sent and received audio in separate channels of a stereo recording—set to conversation to enable this.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.Channels
member.summary: The number of channels to record (maximum 32). If the number of participants exceeds channels any additional participants will be added to the last channel in file. split conversation must also be enabled

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.EndOnSilence
member.summary: Stop recording after n seconds of silence. Once the recording is stopped the recording data is sent to event_url. The range of possible values is 3<=endOnSilence<=10.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.EndOnKey
member.summary: Stop recording when a digit is pressed on the handset. Possible values are: *, # or any single digit e.g. 9

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.TimeOut
member.summary: The maximum length of a recording in seconds. One the recording is stopped the recording data is sent to event_url. The range of possible values is between 3 seconds and 7200 seconds (2 hours)

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.BeepStart
member.summary: Set to true to play a beep when a recording starts

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.EventUrl
member.summary: The URL to the webhook endpoint that is called asynchronously when a recording is finished. If the message recording is hosted by Nexmo, this webhook contains the URL you need to download the recording and other meta data.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.EventMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method used to make the request to eventUrl. The default value is POST.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.Uuid
member.summary: The unique ID of the Call leg for the user to capture the speech of.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.EndOnSilence
member.summary: Controls how long the system will wait after user stops speaking to decide the input is completed. The default value is 2 (seconds). The range of possible values is between 1 second and 10 seconds.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.Language
member.summary: Expected language of the user's speech. Format: BCP-47. Default: en-US see list of supported languages: https://developer.nexmo.com/voice/voice-api/guides/asr#language

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.Context
member.summary: Array of hints (strings) to improve recognition quality if certain words are expected from the user.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.StartTimeout
member.summary: Controls how long the system will wait for the user to start speaking. The range of possible values is between 1 second and 10 seconds.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.MaxDuration
member.summary: Controls maximum speech duration (from the moment user starts speaking). The default value is 60 (seconds). The range of possible values is between 1 and 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.StreamAction.StreamUrl
member.summary: An array containing a single URL to an mp3 or wav (16-bit) audio file to stream to the Call or Conversation.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.StreamAction.Level
member.summary: Set the audio level of the stream in the range -1 >=level<=1 with a precision of 0.1. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.StreamAction.BargeIn
member.summary: Set to true so this action is terminated when the user presses a button on the keypad. Use this feature to enable users to choose an option without having to listen to the whole message in your Interactive Voice Response (IVR ). If you set bargeIn to true on one more Stream actions then the next non-stream action in the NCCO stack must be an input action. The default value is false. Once bargeIn is set to true it will stay true (even if bargeIn: false is set in a following action) until an input action is encountered

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.StreamAction.Loop
member.summary: The number of times audio is repeated before the Call is closed. The default value is 1. Set to 0 to loop infinitely.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.Text
member.summary: A string of up to 1,500 characters (excluding SSML tags) containing the message to be synthesized in the Call or Conversation. A single comma in text adds a short pause to the synthesized speech. To add a longer pause a break tag needs to be used in SSML. To use SSML tags, you must enclose the text in a speak element.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.BargeIn
member.summary: Set to true so this action is terminated when the user presses a button on the keypad. Use this feature to enable users to choose an option without having to listen to the whole message in your Interactive Voice Response (IVR ). If you set bargeIn to true on one more Stream actions then the next non-stream action in the NCCO stack must be an input action. The default value is false. Once bargeIn is set to true it will stay true (even if bargeIn: false is set in a following action) until an input action is encountered

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.Loop
member.summary: The number of times text is repeated before the Call is closed. The default value is 1. Set to 0 to loop infinitely.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.Level
member.summary: The volume level that the speech is played. This can be any value between -1 to 1 with 0 being the default.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.VoiceName
member.summary: The name of the voice used to deliver text. You use the voiceName that has the correct language, gender and accent for the message you are sending. For example, the default voice kimberly is a female who speaks English with an American accent (en-US). Possible values are listed in the Text-To-Speech guide.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.StreamCommand.StreamUrl
member.summary: An array of URLs pointing to the .mp3 or .wav audio file to stream.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.StreamCommand.Loop
member.summary: Set to 0 to replay the audio file at stream_url when the stream ends.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.StreamCommand.Level
member.summary: Set the audio level of the stream in the range -1 >= level <= 1 with a precision of 0.1. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.TalkCommand.Text
member.summary: A UTF-8 and URL encoded string of up to 1500 characters containing the message to be synthesized in the Call or Conversation. Each comma in text adds a short pause to the synthesized speech.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.TalkCommand.VoiceName
member.summary: The name of the voice used to deliver text. You use the voice_name that has the correct language, gender and accent for the message you are sending. For example, the default voice kimberley is a female who speaks English with an American accent (en-US). Possible values for voice_name are listed at https://docs.nexmo.com/voice/voice-api/api-reference#talk_put

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.TalkCommand.Loop
member.summary: Set to 0 to replay the audio file at stream_url when the stream ends. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.Voice.TalkCommand.Level
member.summary: The volume level that the speech is played. This can be any value between -1 to 1 in 0.1 increments, with 0 being the default.
